gram001.title: Mastering Subject-Verb Agreement
gram001.summary: Learn the foundational rule of English syntax for clear and professional writing.
gram001.insightSpark: Find a complex paragraph in a book. Why does the subject-verb agreement work?
gram001.author: Boluadeoye

eng002.title: Building Effective Paragraphs
eng002.summary: Learn to organize ideas into cohesive paragraphs with topic sentences, supporting details, and transitions.
eng002.insightSpark: Rewrite a paragraph from an old essay using the techniques learned. What is the impact?
eng002.author: Boluadeoye

eng003.title: Using Figurative Language
eng003.summary: Incorporate metaphors, similes, and personification to enrich descriptions and evoke emotions.
learningObjectives: Define different types of figurative language.
Apply these devices in your own sentences.
eng003.insightSpark: Describe your morning coffee using a surprising metaphor or simile.
eng003.author: Boluadeoye

eng004.title: Understanding Idioms and Phrasal Verbs
eng004.summary: Explore common idioms and phrasal verbs to add nuance and authenticity to your writing.
learningObjectives: Use common expressions correctly in context.
eng004.insightSpark: Write a short dialogue between two characters that is full of idioms.
eng004.author: Boluadeoye

eng005.title: Self-Editing and Proofreading
eng005.summary: Develop methods to revise your work for grammar, style, and clarity to produce polished final drafts.
eng005.insightSpark: Take a piece of your own writing from six months ago and apply your new proofreading checklist.
eng005.author: Boluadeoye

eng006.title: Techniques for Persuasive Writing
eng006.summary: Master rhetorical devices and argumentative strategies to craft compelling essays and opinion pieces.
eng006.insightSpark: Write a short, persuasive argument for a controversial but trivial opinion you hold.
eng006.author: Boluadeoye

gram002.title: The Art of the Semicolon
gram002.summary: Learn the proper use of the semicolon to connect related independent clauses with style and precision.
learningObjectives: Use semicolons to improve sentence flow.
gram002.insightSpark: Craft a single, beautiful sentence that correctly uses a semicolon to join two ideas.
gram002.author: Boluadeoye

lit001.title: Introduction to World Literature
lit001.summary: Discover key works from diverse cultures to broaden your understanding of global storytelling traditions.
learningObjectives: Identify two major non-Western literary traditions.
lit001.insightSpark: Find a folk tale from another culture and identify a universal theme within it.
lit001.author: Boluadeoye

lit002.title: Decoding Shakespeare's Plays
lit002.summary: Analyze themes, language, and characters in Shakespeare's works to appreciate their enduring relevance.
learningObjectives: Analyze a character's motives in a Shakespearean tragedy.
lit002.insightSpark: Rewrite a famous line from Shakespeare in modern, everyday language. What is lost or gained?
lit002.author: Boluadeoye

lit003.title: The Craft of Short Story Writing
lit003.summary: Study elements like plot twists and concise narratives to create and critique your own short stories.
learningObjectives: Define the concept of 'in medias res'.
lit003.insightSpark: Write a complete story in just six words.
lit003.author: Boluadeoye

lit004.title: Themes in Modern Novels
lit004.summary: Examine contemporary novels to uncover themes like identity, society, and technology in today's world.
learningObjectives: Identify three major themes in a chosen modern novel.
Connect literary themes to current events.
lit004.insightSpark: If you were to write a novel about the 2020s, what would its central theme be?
lit004.author: Boluadeoye

lit005.title: Mythology and Its Influence
lit005.summary: Trace ancient myths through modern texts to understand archetypal patterns and symbolic storytelling.
learningObjectives: Identify a mythological archetype in a modern film or book.
lit005.insightSpark: Create a modern-day mythological hero. What are their powers and fatal flaws?
lit005.author: Boluadeoye

lit006.title: Introduction to Poetic Forms
lit006.summary: Learn to identify and appreciate different poetic structures, from the sonnet to the haiku.
learningObjectives: Identify the structure of a sonnet.
lit006.insightSpark: Try to write a short poem about a technical object, like a smartphone.
lit006.author: Boluadeoye

eng007.title: Active vs. Passive Voice
eng007.summary: Understand the difference between active and passive voice to make your writing more direct and impactful.
learningObjectives: Differentiate between active and passive constructions.
Convert passive sentences to active ones.
eng007.insightSpark: Find an example of passive voice in a news article. Why do you think the author used it?
eng007.author: Boluadeoye

lit007.title: Anatomy of a Character Arc
lit007.summary: Learn the principles of character development, from creating compelling backstories to plotting satisfying arcs.
learningObjectives: Define the three main types of character arcs.
Plot a simple arc for a new character.
lit007.insightSpark: What is the character arc of your favorite movie protagonist?
lit007.author: Boluadeoye

eng008.title: Writing with Clarity and Conciseness
eng008.summary: Master techniques for eliminating jargon, simplifying complex sentences, and making your point effectively.
eng008.insightSpark: Take a dense paragraph of academic or corporate writing and rewrite it in plain, simple English.
eng008.author: Boluadeoye
